item.title: Simple Vim snippet for markdown files
item.author: mhcerri at gmail dot com (Marcelo Henrique Cerri)
item.description: In markdown, fenced code blocks are handy because they allow you to explicitly define the language to be used to highlight your code. The only problem is that it’s a bit painful to enter the triple backquotes (```) with a non US keyboard. To make it easier to write markdown documents, I use the following config in my ~/.vimrc: au BufNewFile,BufRead *.md iabbrev ''' ``` That way every time I type triple quotes (''') followed by a new line or a space it’s replaced by the triple backquotes.
